title: ISic002727. Inscription recording works undertaken by the agoranomos Herakleios
body:
1Ἡράκλειος Διονυσίου
2Πετρεῖνος ἀγορανομέων
3ἐκ τῶν ἰδίων

1ΗΡΑΚΛΕΙΟΣΔΙΟΝΥΣΙΟΥ
2ΠΕΤΡΕΙΝΟΣΑΓΟΡΑΝΟΜΕΩΝ
3ΕΚΤΩΝΙΔΙΩΝ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of ISegesta;
  • 3: The final Ν is underdotted in I.Segesta, but it is unclear why, as the text is completely clear in the photograph.

English translation

Jonathan Prag

Herakleios Petreinos, son of Dionysios, while serving as agoranomos, at his own expense.

Italian translation

http://zotero.org/groups/382445/items/3PK3JKXR

Herakleios figlio di Dionysios, di Petra, mentre era agoranomos (ha fatto) a sue spese [transl. of I.Segesta]

commentary

A city of Petra is recorded in Entella A1 = ISic030298, and so presumably in this region of Sicily; but given that Herakleios holds a magistracy in Segesta, the onomastic element Petreinos is presumably a demotic, and should this refer to the same Petra, the implication is presumably that Petra is now a village of Segesta, or similar.

bibliography

  • 45.1392 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • Nenci 1995 1182 no.1 tav.267.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001415
  • Nenci 1997 1191 tav.CCXXXIV.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001729
  • Giustolisi 1999 135 ph dr https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001944
  • De Vido 2003 400 no.11 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002041
  • Dubois 2008 86 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000160
  • Ampolo and Erdas 2019 G17 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001036
